Resources

Videos

SplinterDB: Closing the Bandwidth Gap for NVMe Key-Value Stores

Seminal paper that introduced SplinterDB to the research community. In this USENIX ATC '20 presentation, Alex Conway describes the principle and innovations behind our novel key-value store.

SplinterDB at the RocksDB meetup

In this RocksDB meetup in October 2020, Abhishek Gupta and Alex Conway introduce the principles behind SplinterDB's no compromise behind insert and query performance.

Publications

SplinterDB: Closing the Bandwidth Gap for NVMe Key-Value Stores

Modern NVMe solid state drives offer significantly higher bandwidth and low latency than prior storage devices. Current key-value stores struggle to fully utilize the bandwidth of such devices. This paper presents SplinterDB, a new key-value store explicitly designed for NVMe solid state drives.
